subject: Ethics
title: Gig Worker Rights
description: A quick, practical guide to Gig Worker Rights.

hook.text: A DoorDash driver earns $4 per delivery, pays for gas, has no health insurance, and can be deactivated in seconds.

buildup.text: Gig companies classify workers as independent contractorsâ€”no benefits, no minimum wage, no unemployment insurance.

discovery.text: This saves companies up to 30% in labor costs while shifting all financial risk onto the workers.

twist.text: California passed AB5 to reclassify gig workers. Uber and Lyft spent $200 million on Prop 22 to reverse it.

climax.text: The gig economy thrives on a loophole: calling employees contractors. Courts are slowly closing that gap.

punchline.text: Flexibility for workers or exploitation by design? Depends on who's profiting.

quiz.question: Why do gig companies prefer classifying workers as independent contractors?
options: It gives workers better benefits and protections
It saves up to 30% in labor costs by avoiding benefits and protections
Independent contractors earn higher wages than employees
